No. 208809)) Sub: Standardization of template for filing petitions under Section 34 & Section 37 of Arbitration and Conciliation Act, 1996 for withdrawal of ongoing court cases at Delhi High Court under Vivad Se Vishwas II" Scheme reg: NHAI vide Circular No. 2.1.60/2023 dated 4th July, 2023 had issued SOP / Guidelines regarding one time settlement  through "Vivad se Vishwas I" (Contractual Disputes). 2 In terms of clause (ix) to (xii) of the aforementioned policy guidelines, NHAI as well as Contractors are required to withdraw ongoing court cases before Hon 'ble Delhi High Court which have been settled in terms of "Vivad se Vishwas Il" scheme- 3 . In order to facilitate the Technical Divisions for implementation of said policy guidelines for withdrawal of court cases, Legal and Arbitration Division has prepared a Standardized Template for petitions under Section 34 and Section 37 of Arbitration and Conciliation Act which will facilitate a seamless and efficient withdrawal process of court cases by the NHAI as  well as contractors. The copies of the templates are attached. (Annexure - | & Il) 4 In view of the above, Technical Divisions are requested to initiate appropriate action for withdrawal of ongoing court cases pertaining to their Divisions by NHAI as well as contractors in terms of said policy guidelines: 5_ This issues with the approval of Competent Authority.
